position_description_html:
Job Description

Duties


A full-time, up to 12 month non-ongoing opportunity exists in our Parramatta National office for an Assistant Director, Human Resources. This role will be responsible for working on projects that develop and enhance organisational capability including developing workforce plans and developing and delivering projects.

Reporting to the Director, Human Resources, your main responsibilities will be to:

• Develop HR Strategies, policies, guidelines and programs to support Corporate Services and Strategy functions and maximise organisational efficiency and the corporate strategic direction of the Agency;
• In conjunction with the Director, Human Resources, develop HR strategy initiatives to support corporate strategic direction of the Agency;
• Oversee and analyse project outputs, aims and objectives for specific projects;
• Coordinate the use of specialist project service providers, including contractors and consultants; and
• Monitor project outcomes and analyse against budget specifications.

Eligibility


To be successful in this role you will need the following:

• Tertiary qualifications in Human Resources;
• Experience in managing HR in a public service environment;
• Proven track record in providing hands on level of specialist, professional and technical expertise in HR programs or discipline areas;
• Demonstrated capability in working collaboratively with contractors, consultants, other branches and business areas, and members of the Executive to support and drive HR business outcomes;
• Proven ability with anticipating and establishing priorities, monitoring progress and work to deliver required corporate outcomes, functions and programs; and
• Experience in identifying, managing and evaluating risk within scope of programs/projects, and managing budget and reporting requirements.

Notes


Salary offered will be between $96,599 and $110,173 per annum depending on skills and experience. In addition, 15.4% superannuation will be paid.

Only candidates who hold Australian citizenship can apply. Refer to the Department of Immigration and Border Protection website www.border.gov.au for further information. Appointment is conditional on successfully completing a national police check.

Please complete an online application form and submit your resume to https://agedcareassessor.submittable.com/submit/70893/assistant-director-human-resources-el-1-non-ongoing-parramatta by 5:00pm (AEST), Wednesday, 18 January 2017.

Only completed applications will be accepted i.e. a completed application form, a current resume and you have addressed the above selection criteria.

For enquiries, please contact Kieran Wong, Director, HR Services on 02 8831 1031.

Further information:

For further information about the Quality Agency, office locations and other related resources, please visit http://www.aacqa.gov.au.

For more information on the Australian Public Service, please visit http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code/factsheet-4 and http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code.

Non-ongoing opportunity will be offered for a specified term

From 1/2/2017 to 1/2/2018
notes_html:

.  applicants found suitable may be offered similar employment opportunities by other Australian Public Service agencies
